medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred to a fetal medicine center due to fetal hydrops at 22 weeks gestation. The current pregnancy was complicated by findings of generalized skin edema, bilateral pleural effusions, and peritoneal effusions in the fetus. The patient had a previous pregnancy at 20 weeks with a fetus showing nonimmune fetal hydrops. The pregnancy was terminated at 27 weeks and 4 days after identifying the cause through genetic testing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous pregnancy with a fetus showing nonimmune fetal hydrops at 20 weeks of gestation.
